channel.title: Class files
channel.description: well i used to do a little coding but i stopped for about a year after i had to wipe my computer.But now i want to start up again the only thing is that i want to open up my class files to edit things but i dont remember wat to open it with or how i did it last time. do i have to download something to open or get a different kind of java. or is their a way to convert them into something i can open. so i could like open it with notepad. srry for asking a dumb question lol any help is appreciated

item.title: Class files
item.dc:creator: @Mendorphins Mendorphins
item.description:
@Mendorphins wrote:

Class files will be jibberish to you because it’s machine code. It’s what the computer can read. You need the Java files so that we humans can read it.

If you only have the class files, then you need a decompiler (compiler turns .java into .class and a decompiler does vice versa), so I did a search for you. I think I got my decompiler from “Zodiac’s Id List & Tools Package 3.0 The Rebirth”: http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,332691.msg2594733.html#msg2594733

I think.

Read full topic
